isSent

public boolean isSent()
Indicates whether this message has been "sent". This flag is initially set to false and is set to true when the writeTo(OutputStream) method is called.

isSent

public void isSent(boolean isSent)
Used to mark whether this message has been "sent".

Parameters:
isSent - - The new value for the "is-sent" property.

getProtocolVersion

public ProtocolVersion getProtocolVersion()

getHeaderNames

public Iterator<String> getHeaderNames()
Returns an iterator for a collection of names that identify the MessageHeader objects currently attached to this message.

containsHeader

public boolean containsHeader(String name)
Indicates whether a header with the specified name is currently attached to this messsage.

Parameters:
name - - The name of a message header. Header names are case-insensitive.

getHeader

public MessageHeader getHeader(String name)
Returns the MessageHeader identified by the specified name if a header with that name is currently attached to this message.

Parameters:
name - - The name of a message header. Header names are case-insensitive.

setHeader

public void setHeader(MessageHeader header)
Adds a header to this message. If a header with the same name is already attached to this message, that header is replaced.

Parameters:
header - - The header to be set.

addHeader

public void addHeader(MessageHeader header)
               throws IllegalArgumentException
Adds a header to this message. If a header with the same name is already attached to this message, the value carried by the new header is appended to the value of the existing header (see MessageHeader.appendHeader(MessageHeader)).

Parameters:
header - - The header to be added.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - The specified head cannot be added to an existing header of the same type.

removeHeader

public MessageHeader removeHeader(String name)
Removes a header from this message.

Parameters:
name - - The name of a message header. Header names are case-insensitive.

removeHeaders

public void removeHeaders()
Removes all headers from this message.

getEntity

public Entity getEntity()
Gets the entity attached to this message or null if no entity is attached.

setEntity

public void setEntity(Entity entity)
Sets or clears the entity for this message.

Parameters:
entity - - The entity to attach to the message. May be null.

consumeContent

public void consumeContent()
                    throws IOException
Consumes the entity attached to this message (if any). See RawEntity.consumeContent().

Throws:
IOException

                   throws IOException
